data.title: Noise Addiction II
data.text:
Pop-O-Pies - Demos 1981 + Transfer, Los Angeles 3-21-85

The demos is 4 different versions of the song Truckin'. I think the last one is a live version. On track 4 the DJ and the band play a tape a record and talk all at the same time so it's not easy to decipher what's going on. I also don't know if any of these versions is the one from the record. It's from a radio broadcast and has excellent sound quality. The live show was recorded from the audience and has good sound quality. Can anyone fill in the song titles?

@ Demo 1981: [from cassette tape]

01. Truckin'

02. Truckin'

03. DJ announcements + interview

04. title unknown

05. Truckin'

@ Transfer, Los Angeles 3-21-85: [from cassette tape]

01. title unknown

02. title unknown

03. title unknown

04. title unknown

05. title unknown

08. title unknown

09. title unknown

10. title unknown

11. title unknown

12. title unknown

Feederz - Graffiti, San Francisco 8-31-84

They do a great cover of the Pink Panther Theme on this show. Doesn't seem it got a proper recording or release. This is an audience recording. Sound quality is good. Can anyone help with the song titles?

Flipper - On Klub, Los Angeles 4-06-84

On this show Flipper play extended versions of their songs. Most songs are 5-8 minutes long. It's an audience recording that has listenable quality. Can anyone fill in the song titles?

Savage Republic - Los Angeles + Demos 1981-1985

The Parking Garage demo is an early recording of the band. The Anti Club show is a special show that featured reunions of some of the previous bands the SR members were in. Three songs from this show were officially released on an LP collection in 1989. The Los Angeles Radio show is an audience recording and may not be from a Radio concert at all, but that's what the tape says. The Ceremonial demo sounds like it was recorded live at a band practice and is from a radio broadcast. All have good sound quality.Can anyone fill in the unknown song titles?

02. Flesh That Walks

This is an audience recording. The vocals are a little low in the mix but the sound quality is good. Move Right In is a Velvet Underground song and tracks 10 and 11 seem like a medley of sorts with parts of track 11 being a version of the K. C. & The Sunshine Band song.

Eyes - Masque, Los Angeles 11-01-77

The Eyes were one of L.A.s early Punk bands and are probably most known for the fact that Charlotte Caffey, who made it big with the Go Gos, was an original member. This original line up only released one song on the What Records 7" ep sampler in 1978 (http://www.discogs.com/Eyes-The-Controllers-The-Skulls-Untitled/release/1874412). One further studio track from this line up was released on the What? Stuff compilation CD in 1998 (http://www.discogs.com/Various-What-Stuff/release/2329905). In 1996 a six song live set, recorded in early 1978, was released in the Live From The Masque vol. 3 CD. This live set features 4 of the songs that have been released plus a Sonny & Cher cover and five songs that haven't been heard anywhere else. This is an audience recording and the sound quality is good. Even thought the tape says 11-01-77, I believe this show happened December 21, 1977, same show as the Flesheaters show I posted a while ago.

Recent reunion show clip: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A6VYFCf54AA

04. title unknown

Both these shows are audience recordings. The Minneapolis show is a bit muddy and the vocals are low in the mix. The Rochester show is a much clearer recording. Can anyone fill in the song titles?

X - Whiskey, Los Angeles 4-80

For the release of their first album, X performed a series of shows at the Whiskey in Hollywood with a few special guests. On this show, Ray Manzarek who was a member of the Doors and producer of the bands album, plays on a few songs, along with Top Jimmy. Billy Zoom also sings on Whole Lotta Lovin' and Bad Boy. It's an audience recording and the sound quality is good.

setlist:

01. Year 1

02. Los Angeles

03. Sex And Dying In High Society

04. Your Phone's Off The Hook, But You're Not

13. We're Desperate

14. Nausea (w/Ray Manzarek)

15. The World's A Mess; It's In My Kiss (w/Ray Manzarek)

16. Roadhouse Blues (w/Ray Manzarek and Top Jimmy)

17. Good Rockin' Tonight (w/Ray Manzarek and Top Jimmy)

Minutemen - KPFK, Los Angeles 1982 + 1985

Both of these are radio broadcasts and have excellent sound quality. Two songs, tracks 2 and 16, from the 1982 show were officially released in 1984 on The Politics Of Time LP. The 1985 broadcast is the complete show but there is a tape flip after Cheerleaders so a second or two of the beginning of Maybe Partying Will Help is missing. Can anyone fill in the song titles?

Savage Republic - Live 1983 + 1985

Three audience recordings. At the Mojave Exodus show the band played with the Minutemen and at the end of their set do a long jam with them. The Wedding Reception show is an audience recording that is missing the last 10 minutes. Sound quality is good on all. Can anyone fill in the unknown song titles?

Dr. Know was a hardcore band from Los Angeles. The demo has very good sound quality and the Cathay show is an audience recording with good sound quality. I think the demo might have been released on their Best of album. Anyone know? Can anyone fill in the song titles.

T.S.O.L. - Demo 1980 + Live 1981

The demo is a muddy copy but still sounds pretty good. The City Gardens show came without a specific date but I have a copy of this same recording, from a few years ago, that is dated November 7, 1981. That copy and this copy are the same up to the song Word Is but on the other tape that song fades out and then versions of Silent Scream and Code Blue are played. The versions of those songs on that tape are different from the versions on this tape. So, it seems, someone added those on from a different source. This is the complete version of this show.. It's a soundboard recording and the sound quality is excellent.

@ Demo 1980:

01. 80 Times

02. Superficial Love

03. You Don't Have To Die

04. Silent Majority

01. Dance With Me

03. Die For Me

04. I'm Tired Of Life

05. Love Story

06. 80 Times

07. Word Is

08. Funeral March

09. The Triangle

10. Silent Scream

11. Code Blue

Castration Squad - KPFK, Los Angeles 12-80

This band featured some members who had been involved in the Los Angeles Punk scene since the beginning. The line up is: Shannon Wilhelm - vocals, Mary Bat-Thing - vocals (pre-45 Grave), Tiffany Kennedy - keyboard , Tracy Lea - guitar (pre-Red Cross), Alice Armendariz - bass (ex-Bags), Elissa Bello - drums (ex-Go Go's). They never released any records and weren't around for very long. But this live show and a couple videos exist to prove the band once existed. This is from a radio broadcast and the sound quality is excellent.

web page here: http://www.alicebag.com/castrationsquadhome.html

video here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KpycendTyJo&feature=related

and here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8IUAoRi33vc

setlist: [from cassette tape]

01. We Are Your God

02. Ex-Girlfriend

03. Date With Jack

04. No Mercy For The Dead

05. Blind

06. Sheila

07. Cruella Deville

08. Bat Thing
